title: Systems Engineer Software Transformation
description:
*Passionate about making ideas a reality? Join our welcoming world of tech and let your ideas soar.*


Your role


We are on an exciting journey within cloud technology and AI, aiming to deliver products and services faster and more efficiently—ultimately benefiting our customers and Saab as a whole. In this role, you will be part of this transformation within Core Technology and Platform, a unit within the Business Unit Digital Battlespace Solutions (BU DBS).


As Systems Engineer Software Transformation within Core Development and Platform, you will be involved in the development and implementation of cloud-based solutions for our Command and Control (C2) platforms across all domains within BU DBS. You will be part of our programme that is developing and delivering our new cloud platform.


A central duty will be to facilitate the transfer of current C2 systems from current platforms to the new platform.


Description of work:

* Analyse SW architecture of existing non-cloud system applications and outline migration path and activities for each system to transform them into a virtualized runtime environment
* Facilitation of the transfer of current C2 systems from current platforms to the new platform.
* Participating in championing of the adoption of cloud-native C2 solutions.
* Suggest suitable SW tools that support transformation from legacy to Cloud and Microservices Architecture
* Collaboration with other parts of BU DBS and also other parts of Saab.


Some travel may be required in this role.


Your profile


We are seeking a highly technical and experienced systems engineer or full stack software developer with a deep understanding of both cloud and classical technologies and development processes. Ideally, you also have experience with military C2 systems. You possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills and you build strong relationships with both internal and external stakeholders.


Essential Skills and Experience:

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering or a related field.
* A strong technical background with expertise in cloud technologies, including virtualization and SW container technologies.
* Deep understanding of cloud architecture and development, including the underlying technical complexities.
* Fluency in Swedish and English, both written and spoken.


Experience of the following is considered meritorious:

* Hyperscalers from the mayor suppliers
* Kubernetes
* Cyber security requirements for both NATO and Sweden
* NATO frameworks and doctrines
* Understanding of end-user requirements and needs, preferably in the Defense sector.
* GIS tools or technologies


We value not only your skills and experience, but also place great importance on your personal qualities. We seek a collaborative individual who thrives in a team environment and actively contributes to a positive and supportive workplace culture.

*This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.*


What you will be part of


Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.


Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.


Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 25,500 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.


Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here
company_description: Saab serves the global market with world-leading products, services and solutions from military defense to civil security.

title: Mechanical Design Engineer
description:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.

**Mechanical Design Engineer****Your role**


As a Mechanical Design Engineer at Capgemini Engineering, you will work on exciting product development projects within the retail industry. Based on your background and experience, you'll contribute to various ongoing projects at our client location, while being part of our growing team of mechanical design experts.

*In this role you will play a key role in:*

* Managing daily client contact and taking responsibility for the execution of assignments from concept to finished product, including product testing, certification, and reliability testing
* Contributing to our in-house team for full-scale project deliveries in the retail sector
* Being a central part of our cross-functional team and taking responsibility for implementations and goals in our projects
* Applying your technical expertise to develop innovative mechanical design solutions that meet client requirements

**Note:** Your local office will be in Malmö, but you need to be able to travel to client location in Älmhult 2-3 times a week.

**Your profile**

* Minimum 3-5 years of experience in product development as a Mechanical Design Engineer or other relevant background
* Proficiency in SolidWorks or other CAD tools
* Experience within Consumer Products and PLM (PTC Windchill preferred)
* Fluent in English and holding an EU work permit, with ability to quickly relocate to Sweden

**What we believe you will enjoy about working here**

* **Innovative Environment:** With us, you'll have the opportunity to work with the latest technology and be part of a dynamic team that loves creating value through innovation.
* **Career Development:** We care about your future and offer development programs and certifications in the latest technologies, so you can grow and become the best version of yourself.
* **Flexible Work:** We understand that life is more than just work. That's why we offer opportunities for remote work and flexible hours to help you feel good and thrive.
* **Team Spirit:** We're like one big family with a strong sense of team spirit. By living our core values—courage, passion, teamwork, and entrepreneurship—we create a work environment where everyone can feel at home.

**Application**


As part of our recruitment process, identity verification or background checks may occasionally be conducted.


#LI-JM16


Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem.

title: Service Transition Manager
description:
**Service Transition Manager till Telia Cygate**  

  

Vi söker nu en Service Transition Manager som vill bli en del av oss på Telia Cygate!


Jag heter Patrik Lännerberg, Head of Network Services, och jag letar efter någon som vill växa tillsammans med oss. Vi är ett stöttande och framtidsinriktat team som fokuserar på leverans av nätverkstjänster till våra kunder i enterprise-segmentet. Teamet förstärks nu med en Service Transition Manager som säkerställer en förstklassig onboarding av nya kunder.


**Vad du kommer att göra i rollen:**

Rollen ansvarar för att vara sammanhållande och drivande i arbetet med on- och off-boarding av nya kunder för Managed Services tjänster. Rollen kan också agera i tjänsteutvecklande initiativ.


Service Transition Managers roll är även att säkerställa en hög kvalitet och etablerade processer för att kundupplevelsen i transitionen landar på bäst möjliga sätt.


**För att lyckas i rollen:**

Du behöver ha en starkt eget driv, ha en lösningsfokuserad tillnärmning till uppgifter och vara uthållig. Vi söker dig med mod, stark integritet och erfarenhet av förändringsarbete.


Du besitter en förmåga att hantera många stakeholders, interna och externa. och förstår komplexa affärer på djupet. Du har ett gediget intresse för kunden och deras upplevelse samtidigt som du kan agera rådgivande för att leda kommersiella och tekniska strömmar i ett projekt. Stor vikt kommer läggas vid personliga egenskaper för denna nyckelroll inom Managed Services


* **Dokumenterad erfarenhet** av transitions- och transformationsprojekt inom Managerade nätverkstjänster och hybrid cloud är ett **krav** . Du har vana av tidrapportering och uppföljning av projektekonomi.
* **God kunskap** om ITIL processer, managerade tjänster och IT-infrastruktur.
* **Förmåga** att leda komplexa projekt samt en god kommunikationsförmåga internt och till kunder.
* **Flytande** i svenska, både tal och skrift.

**Varför Telia Cygate?**

På Telia Cygate är vi inte bara experter på nätverk, säkerhet och olika slags moln – vi är också ett gäng som tycker att det ska vara kul att gå till jobbet! Som en del av Telia Company har vi styrkan att skapa verklig påverkan i stor skala, bidra till samhällsnytta och hjälpa våra kunder att navigera i digitaliseringens värld. Vi gör det alltid med värme, omtanke och ett leende. Här är det idéerna och våra olika perspektiv som gör oss starka, och tillsammans ser vi till att teknikens värld blir en plats där alla trivs – och där du hör hemma.


Hos oss är din utveckling viktig. Vi uppmuntrar till kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och ser till att just du och dina intressen är i fokus. Vi vet att det är människorna som utgör vårt företag, och därför värdesätter vi glädje, kreativitet och olika perspektiv i allt vi gör.


Välkommen att växa tillsammans med oss, där vi gör teknik mänsklig och skapar verklig påverkan **!**

**Vad vi erbjuder**  

När du börjar hos oss får du ett omfattande förmånspaket anpassat efter din lokala marknad, möjlighet till hybridarbete och mer. Du har också chans att få bonus baserat på din prestation och Telias resultat.


**Låter det intressant?**

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan senast **2025-12-07.** Rollen kan komma att stängas tidigare om vi hittar rätt kandidat – så vänta inte för länge!


Placeringsort: Enligt överenskommelse


Om du går vidare i processen kommer du att kontaktas av vår **Talent Acquisition Partner** . Bakgrund- och referenskontroller ingår i processen.


Vill du veta mer om rollen? Kontakta gärna Patrik Lännerberg, Head of Network Services på patrik.lannerberg@cygate.se.


**Lika möjligheter för alla**

På Telia värderar vi kompetens och utvecklingspotential. Vi främjar mångfald och ser till att varje individs behov tillgodoses, oavsett funktionsvariation, kön, ålder, nationalitet, sexuell läggning eller social bakgrund. Tillsammans skapar vi en inkluderande arbetsmiljö där din unikhet är vår styrka.


**Välkommen till Telia Cygate – Home of Experts**

title: Online Merchandiser
description:
**NilsonGroup AB är en av Skandinaviens ledande skokoncerner med E-handel och butiker i Sverige och Norge. Genom våra butikskoncept DinSko och Skopunkten kan vi erbjuda något som passar för alla. Ett oslagbart utbud med låga priser för hela familjen. Vill du jobba med mode och skor är NilsonGroup det självklara valet - vi gör det enkelt, kul och inspirerande att handla skor!**

**Vi satsar nu på att lyfta vår digitala försäljning – och nu söker vi en Online Merchandiser.**


Här får du jobba nära våra koncept DinSko och Skopunkten, där du varje dag gör skillnad för trafiken, konverteringen och försäljningen. Du blir en del av ett litet men engagerat e-handelsteam och samarbetar med marknad, IT och kundservice.


Det här är rätt roll för dig som älskar att kombinera kommersiellt driv med analys och som tycker att e-handel är den bästa butiksmiljön som finns.

**Dina ansvarsområden**


Som Online Merchandiser ansvarar du för hur produkterna presenteras, exponeras och presterar på våra webbplatser. Du säkerställer att kunden möts av rätt produkt, i rätt sammanhang, vid rätt tillfälle.


Du arbetar självständigt, datadrivet och testar, optimerar och analyserar – alltid med målet att öka trafik, konvertering och försäljning.

  

Du kommer bland annat ha följande arbetsuppgifter:

* Säkerställa produktpresentation, innehåll och kampanjer på våra webbplatser
* Optimera sortiment, kategorier, produktsidor och produktplacering
* Planera och publicera kampanjer, uppdatera startsidor och landningssidor
* Säkerställa att produkter är lätta att hitta via sök, filtrering och navigation
* Följa KPI:er (trafik, konvertering, försäljning) och agera utifrån insikter
* Arbeta med SEO & GEO, metadata och onsite search
* Genomföra A/B-tester och andra konverteringsoptimerande aktiviteter
* 

**Din profil**


Vi söker dig som har:

  

* Yrkes- eller högskoleutbildning inom digital kommunikation & försäljning, marknadsföring eller motsvarande erfarenhet
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av arbete i CMS (gärna som Online Merchandiser eller liknande)
* Erfarenhet av att skapa content (i CMS och Triggerbee)
* Goda kunskaper i Adobe Creative Cloud (som Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign osv.)
* Goda kunskaper i GA4, SEO/GEO, HTML, CSS och A/B-testning
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med relevansmotorer
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska
* Datadrivet arbetssätt och trygg i KPI-uppföljning


Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet från mode/e-handel och/eller att du tidigare har arbetat med att skapa content samt har erfarenhet av att jobba med AI-verktyg.

**Dina personliga egenskaper**


Vi tror att du är

* Kommersiell och datadriven – du agerar på siffror och resultat
* Trygg i e-handelssystem och CMS
* Kommunikativ och trivs med att samarbeta med andra
* Är driven, tar initiativ och arbetar självständigt

**Information om tjänsten**


Omfattning: 40 h/v. Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning som inleds med provanställning


Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse


Kontakt: Vid frågor om tjänsten kontakta HR-avdelningen via hr@nilsongroup.com


Sista ansökningsdag är 2025-12-07. Intervjuer hålls löpande under ansökningstiden varpå tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.


Observera att vi endast tar emot ansökningar via länk till vårt rekryteringssystem, ej via e-post.


Låter detta som en tjänst för dig?

**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**

title: Marknadsförare till Online Partner
description:
**Om Online Partner**


Online Partner är en av Sveriges främsta specialister på molnbaserade lösningar från Google. Vi hjälper företag och skolor att effektivisera sina arbetsprocesser med moderna och smarta verktyg.


Vår vision är att vara den största, ledande och mest föredragna partnern för molnbaserade produktivitetslösningar på de marknader vi verkar. Vi är ett företag i tillväxt och har en stark och positiv företagskultur där vi lär av varandra och uppmuntrar till initiativ.  

  

  



**Om rollen**


Som marknadsförare hos oss kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i att stärka vårt varumärke och driva vår digitala närvaro. Du kommer att arbeta brett med marknadsföring, från taktik till operativt genomförande. Rollen tillhör säljavdelningen. I rollen ingår bland annat:


* Bidra till och utveckla vår marknadsföringsstrategi.
* Skapa och publicera engagerande innehåll i våra digitala kanaler (hemsida, sociala medier, nyhetsbrev etc.).


* Föreslå, planera och genomföra marknadsaktiviteter och kampanjer tillsammans med kundansvariga.


* Ansvara för SEO och SEM för att öka vår synlighet.


* Analysera och följa upp våra marknadsinsatser på ett datadrivet sätt.


- Samarbeta med sälj- och produktteam för att säkerställa att vår kommunikation är i linje med våra affärsmål.


* Hantera Marknadsfonder mot Google, både ansökan och uppföljning.

  

Effekter av ditt arbete:


* Medvetenhet i huvudmålgrupper om Online Partners erbjudanden
* Genererade leads


* Genererade kundbesök


* Rankning av Online Partners erbjudanden i Googles sökmotor


* Nöjda kunder och säljare


* Välbesökta kundaktiviteter

 **Vem är du?**


Vi söker dig som har relevant utbildning inom marknadsföring, kommunikation och/eller motsvarande. Du har minst ett par års erfarenhet av en liknande roll, gärna från ett IT-konsultbolag eller SaaS-företag.


Du är en van skribent och har erfarenhet av att skapa innehåll för olika kanaler. Vidare har du goda kunskaper inom SEO, SEM och sociala medier.


Du gillar att vara en del i ett engagerat och kompetent team där det mesta arbetet sker på kontoret tillsammans.  

  

  



Som person är du kreativ, initiativtagande och har en förmåga att omsätta idéer till konkreta resultat. Du är strukturerad, analytisk och trivs med att arbeta i ett högt tempo. Då vi är ett team som värdesätter samarbete är det viktigt att du är en lagspelare som gillar att bolla idéer med dina kollegor.

 **Meriterande:**


* Erfarenhet av Google Workspace och Google Cloud Platform.


* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med marketing automation-verktyg som HubSpot.


* Kunskaper inom grafisk formgivning och videoproduktion.

  


**Vad vi erbjuder**


Vi erbjuder en utvecklande och dynamisk arbetsplats med stora möjligheter att påverka. Du blir en del av ett engagerat team med hög kompetens och en stark vilja att lyckas. Vi sitter i fräscha lokaler i Stockholm.


*Till rekryterare och bemanningsföretag säger vi vänligt men bestämt nej.*

title: Driven BIM-samordnare/Digitaliseringsledare sökes till Malmö
description:
Plan B är ett av Sveriges mest meriterade företag inom effektivisering av samhällsbyggnadsbranschen. Vi arbetar med allt från mindre, snabbrörliga uppdrag till stora miljardprojekt inom infrastruktur och anläggning. Vårt namn, Plan B, symboliserar ett annat sätt att göra saker på – vi utmanar traditionella arbetssätt och driver branschen mot smartare, mer digitala lösningar.


Nu söker vi en uppdragsdrivande, strukturerad och affärsorienteradBIM-samordnare/Digitaliseringsledare med placering i Malmö. Rollen passar dig som vill arbeta nära både teknik, människor och processer, och som vill bidra till utvecklingen av framtidens digitala arbetssätt i samhällsbyggandet.


**Vem är du?**


Du är en person som trivs i gränslandet mellan teknik, struktur och samordning. Med minst tre års erfarenhet av informationshantering eller BIM-relaterade roller inom anläggnings- eller infrastrukturprojekt har du byggt en naturlig förståelse för hur modeller, dokument och informationsflöden hänger ihop. Du har en relevant utbildning i ryggen – eller motsvarande kunskap förvärvad i praktiken – och är trygg i att arbeta med olika CAD- och BIM-verktyg.


Som person är du nyfiken, initiativtagande och har ett öga för detaljer. Du trivs när du får skapa ordning, driva förbättringar och arbeta nära projektens olika discipliner. Du uttrycker dig obehindrat på både svenska och engelska, navigerar bekvämt i komplexa projektmiljöer och känner dig hemma i arbetssätt med tydliga informationskrav. Har du tidigare arbetat praktiskt med projektering eller modellering är det en fördel, eftersom det gör att du snabbt kan sätta dig in i andra discipliners behov och perspektiv.


För att lyckas i rollen är det meriterande om du har erfarenhet av:

* CDE-plattformar som Autodesk Construction Cloud (ACC Docs), Dalux eller StreamBIM
* Projekteringsverktyg såsom Revit, Tekla, AutoCAD, MicroStation eller Plant 3D
* Modellgranskningsverktyg som Navisworks, Solibri eller Bentley Navigator
* Dokumentgranskning i Bluebeam Revu
* Arbetssätt som bygger på ISO 19650-serien, RDS eller CoClass
* Hantering av informationskrav (EIR/BEP) och spårbarhet mellan modeller, dokument och metadata
  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter**


I rollen får du ett brett ansvar som handlar om att hålla ihop struktur, kvalitet och leveranser inom projektens informationshantering. Det innebär att du följer upp och säkerställer att modeller, dokument och metadata möter ställda krav, samtidigt som du stöttar projektorganisationen i frågor kopplade till informationsflöden och samordning.


Du arbetar nära projektens olika discipliner, deltar i möten och rapporterar framdrift, och du hjälper till att skapa tydlighet genom att ta fram mallar, installation- och hjälpfiler för ritning- och modellhantering samt samordningsmodeller. Rollen kan också innebära ansvar för onboarding och offboarding i olika projektspecifika datamiljöer, liksom att säkerställa att alla handlingar, DU-dokumentation och leveranser kommer in korrekt och i rätt format.


Du blir en viktig länk i kvalitetskontrollerna och ser till att filstrukturer, informationskrav och leveransprocesser håller en hög och jämn nivå. Kort sagt: du bidrar till att projekten får en stabil och välfungerande informationsgrund att driva sitt arbete från.


**Värt att veta**


Hos Plan B blir du en del av en miljö som präglas av kunniga kollegor, prestigelös samverkan och en stark vilja att utveckla branschen. Din bas är i **Malmö**, men du kommer tillhöra vårt kontor i Göteborg. Rollen ger möjlighet till flexibla arbetsformer när projektens förutsättningar tillåter. Samtidigt innebär vissa uppdrag arbete på plats hos kund eller i projektets lokaler, vilket ger dig nära kontakt med verksamheten och deras behov.


Vi erbjuder en arbetsplats där du får arbeta med både komplexa och samhällsviktiga projekt, och där innovation och ansvar är centrala drivkrafter. Här få du stora möjligheter att utvecklas, dela kunskap och vara med och forma hur branschen tar nästa steg i sin digitala resa. Framför allt blir du del av ett team som brinner för att göra skillnad – och som alltid strävar efter att göra saker lite smartare.


**Ansökan**  

Verkar det intressant? Sök nu – vi är alltid intresserade av människor som är intresserade av oss.

title: Lead QA Engineer – Test Automation
description:
*Are you passionate about quality and automation? Do you want to help development teams build better software- faster?*


Tacton is now looking for a Lead QA Engineer for Test Automation who loves structure, frameworks, and smart automation. This role focuses on preventing regressions and accelerating delivery, not through manual testing, but through better practices, smarter tooling, and a strong quality culture.


You’ll combine a developer’s mindset with a quality-first approach, inspire teams by knowledge sharing, refining frameworks, implementing good examples and making sure everyone has the tools, data, and guidance they need to deliver with confidence.


You’ll be part of our R&D team of passionate developers, Dev Leads, and architects who love building great software together. This is a new role and an exciting next step for us, as we take testing and quality to the next level. In this role, you will report to VP Engineering.

**What You’ll Do**

* **Own and evolve** our test automation frameworks, updating the code base, improving structure, and ensuring it’s easy to understand what’s covered (and what’s not).
* **Enable teams** to build the right tests at the right level, unit, system, and integration, while ensuring each team remains responsible for their own quality.
* **Define best practices** for testing across the organization, including when and how to use specific test types.
* **Champion modern testing practices** including AI-assisted testing and data generation.
* **Collaborate closely** with Dev Leads to make adding and maintaining automated tests easier for their teams.
* **Measure and communicate** quality metrics such as coverage, reliability, and test effectiveness, and help define realistic targets.

**Who You Are**

* 7+ years of experience within development, QA and test automation.
* Technical background (development or technical QA) — strong scripting/coding skills
* Proven experience with test frameworks and automation tools, experience with AI testing tools, data generation, or performance testing.
* Skilled at influencing teams and introducing best practices.
* Curious to understand our business behind the software, not just the code.
* Excellent communicator who enjoys working with all colleagues within R&D.

**Nice to have:**

* Familiarity with cloud environments (AWS, Azure) and SaaS platforms.


Furthermore, it’s important that you’re interested in our product, our CPQ solution, and that you’re eager to develop a deep understanding of the CPQ business domain over time, enabling you to design meaningful end-to-end test scenarios that reflect real customer use cases.

**Why You’ll Love Working Here**


At Tacton, quality isn’t just a checkbox — it’s a mindset. You’ll join a highly technical product company where testing and automation have a direct impact on speed, reliability, and customer experience. In this position, you’ll have the opportunity to shape how we test and deliver across our global SaaS platform.

**We offer:**

* A solid and stable company with over 20 years of industry experience.
* A flexible hybrid work model (3 days in the Stockholm office).
* A collaborative and open culture where engineering and quality go hand-in-hand.
* 33 days of paid time off – 30 vacation days, plus 3 extra days
* Generous wellness allowance – to support your health and wellbeing.
* Private healthcare insurance – Get quick access to private medical care
* Weekly treats – Fika and breakfasts, because good food brings people together.

**Ready to shape how we build and test at Tacton?**  

Apply today and help us take quality automation to the next level. Please apply no later than 10:th of December.


**About Tacton:** Tacton is a global SaaS leader in CPQ (Configure, Price, Quote), empowering manufacturers to streamline complex sales processes and drive growth. Headquartered in Stockholm with offices in Chicago, Karlsruhe, and Warsaw, we’re a 220-person team on an exciting growth journey. Recognized by Gartner as a market leader, our technology helps global manufacturers solve real-world configuration challenges and stay competitive in a rapidly changing world.


Learn more at **tacton.com/about**

title: BNEW Total Rewards SME
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**

  

Imagine reimagining how we value, reward, and energize talent in one of the world's most innovative technology companies. As Total Rewards (TR) SME for Business Area Networks (BNEW), you'll be at the forefront of transforming how we attract, retain, and inspire exceptional people across diverse global markets. This isn't just about managing compensation programs—it's about architecting reward strategies that fuel ambition, recognize contribution, and create genuine equity in how we celebrate success.


You'll pioneer a new generation of Total Rewards that seamlessly blends fairness, transparency, and innovation with cutting-edge technology. Working at the intersection of people strategy and business transformation, you'll help shape programs that don't just meet today's needs but anticipate tomorrow's workforce expectations.

 **About BNEW:**

  

Business Area Networks (BNEW) is where 5G was born! We’re a global team of approx. 30,000 in 94 countries, with 138 nationalities represented. About half of us work in R&D, approx. 8,000 in Group Supply and 5,000 in Service Area Networks. BNEW holds the group responsibility for Supply and part of Service Delivery.


We lead the shift towards open programmable cloud-native networks with the best performance, security, and energy efficiency at the lowest TCO. Our approach is simple: We build solutions that empower our customers to meet tomorrow’s demands.


We're not just building networks; we're defining the future and leading the way in innovation.

 **What you will do:**

  

Collaborate with TR SMEs across Ericsson to revolutionize every dimension of Total Rewards:

* Base Pay Management – Together with our global TR team Design equitable compensation structures that reflect market dynamics and internal fairness
* Variable Pay – Create performance-driven reward mechanisms that energize and align teams with business outcomes
* Recognition – Build meaningful moments of appreciation that strengthen culture and belonging
* Progressive, Flexible Benefits and Wellbeing – Champion holistic programs that support diverse lifestyles and life stages
* Retirement Benefits – Secure futures through thoughtful, sustainable pension strategies


Transforming TR Through AI: We are on a journey to shape the organization and the people function thru usage of AI.

  

You'll lead the charge in leveraging artificial intelligence to revolutionize our Total Rewards function in BNEW. Envision using AI to analyze compensation equity in real-time, predict retention risks before they materialize, and personalize benefits recommendations for individual employees. You'll implement intelligent automation that eliminates manual processes, freeing up time for you and the people organization to focus on strategic thinking and human connection. Through predictive analytics, you'll uncover hidden patterns linking engagement, performance, and reward effectiveness—transforming data into actionable insights that drive both business results and employee satisfaction. This is about building a smarter, faster, more responsive TR function that anticipates needs rather than reacts to them.

**The skills you bring:**

* Genuine passion for Total Rewards and Analytics, backed by proven experience
* Expertise in benefits design.
* Exceptional communication abilities—you can inspire C-suite executives and frontline managers alike
* Natural collaboration skills that break down silos and build bridges across functions
* A forward-thinking mindset ready to modernize TR by connecting engagement and performance with reward strategies, and embracing AI to create leaner, more intelligent processes
* 10+ years pioneering Compensation & Benefits, People Analytics, and/or Total Rewards
* International experience navigating multi-country complexities and country-specific legislation
* Mastery of compensation benchmarking tools, analytics platforms, and HR technology
* Ability to balance visionary strategy with practical execution
* Minimum Bachelor's degree in HR, Business, Finance, or related field

  

Ready to redefine what's possible in Total Rewards? Join the new era where we shape the future of the organization together.

 **Note: Security clearance including references and relevant background screening will be conducted for final candidates.**

 **Last date to apply- 4th December 2025**

 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

**Primary Recruiter:** Versha Sharma

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
**Shape the Future of Our Data-Driven Strategy within Nordic Tyre Group AB!**


We are searching for a seasoned Senior Data Scientist to join our technology team at a pivotal moment. As the largest tyre wholesaler in the Nordics and Baltics, our data is the foundation of strategic decision-making across our multi-country operations. This is your chance to be a driving force in unlocking insights from our vast datasets, building predictive models, and developing data science solutions that will transform our purchasing, inventory, sales, and finance strategies for years to come. This role is a strategic hire fully backed by our executive team and will report into group CIO.

**Data Science Strategy & Implementation**

* Lead end-to-end data science initiatives from problem definition to production deployment
* Develop, implement and improve advanced analytics solutions for demand forecasting, pricing optimization, cross-sell recommendations, lead prioritization, customer churn, and customer segmentation
* Design and execute A/B testing frameworks to drive data-informed business decisions
* Translate complex analytical findings into actionable business recommendations

**Technical Leadership & Collaboration**

* Work closely with our data engineer and ERP developers to understand business data architecture and identify opportunities for data science applications
* Implement ML workflow orchestration using tools such as Kedro, MLflow, AWS SageMaker, or Azure ML
* Query and manipulate large datasets using MySQL, dbt, Athena, Iceberg, S3, or equivalent technologies
* Ensure models are scalable, maintainable, and production-ready in cloud environments

**Business Impact & Strategy**

* Collaborate closely with stakeholders from Procurement, Sales, Finance, and Logistics to identify and execute high-impact data science opportunities
* Apply commercial acumen to prioritize initiatives based on potential business value and feasibility
* Present findings and recommendations to senior leadership and cross-functional teams
* Drive the adoption of data-driven decision making across the organisation

**Required Skills & Experience**

* Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Economics)
* 5+ years of data science experience, ideally in retail, wholesale, distribution, or e-commerce environments
* Strong programming skills in Python and SQL, with experience in data science libraries and frameworks
* Proficiency in machine learning algorithms: linear regression, k-means clustering, random forest, gradient boosting, and others
* Experience with large-scale data processing using MySQL, DBT, Athena, Iceberg, S3, or equivalent tools
* Hands-on experience with ML workflow orchestration platforms (Kedro, MLflow, Airflow, AWS SageMaker, Azure ML, or similar)
* Proven track record working within cloud environments, preferably AWS or Azure
* Ability to independently lead data science projects with minimal supervision
* Proficient in English


We believe the best candidates are those who are passionate about continuous learning. If you don't tick every box but are committed to developing your skills and growing with us, please apply - we're invested in supporting your professional development. You will have the opportunity to grow as a domain expert, take on leadership responsibilities, and directly create and see real value from your work across our business.

**Nice to Have**

* Previous experience in consulting or private equity
* Experience working with ERP systems and understanding enterprise data structures
* Knowledge of tire wholesale, automotive parts distribution, or similar industries
* Familiarity with business intelligence tools and data visualization platforms

**Key Attributes**

* Commercially minded with strong business acumen to assess project impact and ROI
* Excellent communicator able to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
* Self-motivated and capable of driving initiatives independently while collaborating effectively across teams
* Passionate about turning data into actionable insights that drive business growth


Department: Business Development & Intelligence.


Role: Senior Data Scientist


Locations: Preferably nearby one of our warehouses: Strängnäs (Swe), Masku (Fi), Gardermoen (No) or Riga (Lv).


Remote status: Hybrid.


Type of employment: Probationary period


Contact: Marcus Segerqvist. marcus.segerqvist@nordictyregroup.com


Applications must be submitted via the link. Selection and interviews will be conducted on an ongoing basis, so please submit your application as soon as possible. All applications will be treated confidentially. Personality tests, work samples, background checks, drug tests and reference checks may be included.


**We look forward to receiving your application!**

title: VCF konsult
description:
**VCF Konsult på Advania**
--------------------------

Som senior tekniker med inriktning på VMware Cloud Foundation 9 blir du central i genomförandet av **avancerade VCF-implementationer hos våra kunder.** Du arbetar nära både arkitekter och kundens driftteam och ansvarar för installation, konfiguration, testning och överlämning av plattformar byggda på vSphere, vSAN och NSX. Rollen innebär att du praktiskt driver projekt genom hela livscykeln och säkerställer stabila, säkra och skalbara lösningar i både nya och befintliga miljöer.

### **Ditt tekniska arbete**


Arbetet omfattar bland annat;

* Management- och workload-domäner
* Nätverksdesign på NSX-nivå
* Konfiguration av lagring och resurspooler
* Automatisering av återkommande moment
* Drift- och livscykelhantering


Utöver ovan nämna arbetsuppgifter kommer du även att arbeta med allt från felsökning i komplexa miljöer till planering av **kapacitet**, **patchning** och **uppgraderingar**. Din tidigare erfarenhet av storskaliga implementationer inom **server**, **lagring** eller **nätverk** gör att du snabbt sätter dig in i kundernas miljöer och kan förutse problem innan de uppstår.

**Din kompetens och utveckling**
--------------------------------


Vi ser gärna att du har **Broadcom-certifieringar inom VCF** eller dess ingående produkter, men lika viktigt är din **praktiska erfarenhet av VMware-plattformen och din vilja att fortsätta utvecklas**. Hos oss får du möjlighet att utbilda dig vidare inom VCF och specialisera dig i takt med att tekniken och kunderna utvecklas.  

  

Du kommer att ingår i vårt konsultteam där du alltid har stöttning av kollegor och där din kompetens blir en viktig del av kundernas digitala resa. Vi söker dig som utgår från någon av våra etablerade regioner och som kan arbeta nära både kunder och kollegor. Rollen innebär också att du behöver vara flexibel och beredd att resa i tjänsten när uppdraget kräver det.

### **Vår arbetskultur och betydelse i praktiken**


Vårt arbetssätt bygger på decentralisering och mandat att fatta beslut nära kunden. Som specialist får du därför ett verkligt inflytande över tekniska vägval och arkitekturella beslut. **Självledarskap** är inte ett värdeord utan en praktisk nödvändighet för att lyckas hos oss.  

  

Vi utgår från Self-Determination Theory, där autonomi, kompetens och tillhörighet är centrala drivkrafter. Det innebär att du arbetar med hög grad av ansvar inom dina expertområden, samtidigt som du ingår i ett erfaret team som delar kunskap och arbetar transparent mot gemensamma mål. Kulturen är professionell, varm och tydlig. Den präglas av förtroende, kvalitet och höga ambitioner.

### **Din professionella profil**


Rollen kräver att du tar ansvar för dina tekniska beslut, kommunicerar transparent och samarbetar effektivt i team där alla strävar mot samma resultat. Du behöver vara trygg i komplexa situationer, initiativtagande när förbättringar kan göras och kunna stå stadigt i dina rekommendationer även när mycket står på spel.


Om du vill arbeta praktiskt med **VCF 9 i avancerade miljöer** och samtidigt vidareutveckla din expertis tillsammans med kunniga kollegor, är du välkommen att ta kontakt och gå vidare mot nästa steg*.*


### **Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**

Visa gärna ditt intresse så snart som möjligt då vi intervjuar löpande. Vi välkomnar sökanden med olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter och synsätt, eftersom vi vet att en bredare mångfald berikar var och en av oss och stärker såväl effektivitet som kreativitet i vårt arbete.


Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en obligatorisk bakgrundskontroll, en för oss kvalitativ kontroll inför ett anställningsbeslut. En anställning hos oss kan även innebära konsultuppdrag i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.  

  

Advania samarbetar även med Ljung & Sjöberg för en proaktiv arbetsplats kopplat till alkohol och droger.

  

Tveka inte att höra av dig om du har några frågor eller funderingar.️
company_description: Advania är ett techbolag som utformar skräddarsydda lösningar och skapar hållbara värden genom smart användning av teknik.

title: Migrations Sales Specialist for the Nordics Region, Enterprise Apps and Migrations
description:
**DESCRIPTION**
---------------


As AWS continues to rapidly grow, we seek a Migrations Sales Specialist to own driving adoption of Amazon Web Services within our Enterprise Segment for Microsoft Workloads within the Nordic region. In this role, you will accelerate adoption and become responsible for revenue growth. This individual will build a business focused on helping enterprise customers innovate and exceed revenue goals. This specialist must have the business savvy and sales leadership background necessary to manage Microsoft workload sales in a cross functional team including sales, partner and product teams to deliver accelerated business growth for AWS and our customers. You will establish and maintain high-level relationships within key accounts, driving migrations, innovation, and modernization capabilities across infrastructure and business application landscapes. This Sales Specialist role has regional responsibility and is part of an AWS Global Sales organization established to position AWS as the best place to host Windows based production workloads. As part of a single-threaded sales team focusing on Enterprise Apps and Migrations to AWS, you will be responsible for working with large strategic customers and their existing account teams to qualify and pursue sales opportunities for enterprise application workloads and datacenter migration projects. You will engage with our segment sales, solutions architects, partner and professional services organizations to drive large and highly complex opportunities to closure. These opportunities will include migrating SQL Server, Exchange, or SharePoint to the AWS cloud. Your commitments will include quota accountability, driving platform adoption within global accounts, market penetration in new and existing enterprise accounts as well as creating public references.  

  

Key job responsibilities  

* Drive adoption of AWS full suite of services into a set of Enterprise customers

  

* Exceed annual revenue and design win targets

  

* Scale out an integrated go-to-market team in a highly complex environment

  

* Develop and execute against a set of goals including customer references, support, professional services, and training

  

* Develop relationships and engage with cross-functional and partner ecosystems to extend reach and drive adoption

  

* Build and leverage relationships with internal and external stakeholders to further adoption of AWS services in the market

  

* Support all AWS operating cadences and represent a consolidated view of the districts to senior AWS leaders.

  

* Lead a Customer Obsessed business that delights our customers
**BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**
------------------------

* Extensive technology related sales and field operations experience working for a software or cloud solutions vendor leading teams that sell to Enterprise accounts
* Bachelor's Degree or equivalent work experience
* Current work experience in the Nordics region
* 10+ years technology related sales and field operations experience working for a software or cloud solutions vendor leading teams that sell to Enterprise accounts • Bachelor's Degree or 10+ years equivalent work experience and current work experience in the Nordics region

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**
----------------------------

* A technical background in engineering, computer science, or MIS a plus
* Track record of developing sustainable new business
* Extensive customer network
* Strong verbal and written communications skills
* A technical background in engineering, computer science, or MIS a plus • Track record of developing sustainable new business • Extensive customer network • Strong verbal and written communications skills

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

title: Digital Architect
description:
Att välja Capgemini innebär att välja ett företag där du får möjlighet att forma din karriär på det sätt du önskar. Här kommer att få stöd och inspiration inom en samarbetsvillig gemenskap med kollegor både lokalt och runt om i världen, som ständigt omdefinierar vad som är möjligt. Du kommer att vara en del av området Cloud and Custom Application (C&CA) på Capgemini. Här kommer du att arbeta med de senaste teknologierna inom Cloud, Integration, AI och mjukvaruutveckling. Vi utvecklar skräddarsydda applikationer och hanterar komplexa integrationer för att maximera teknikens potential. Följ med oss och samarbeta med världens ledande organisationer för att realisera teknikens fulla värde genom innovativa lösningar

**Om rollen**  

Capgeminis Digitala Arkitekt-team i Skåne söker nya kollegor! Som Digital Arkitekt arbetar du med att designa och modernisera integrationer och större lösningar hos våra kunder. Med både bredd och djup erbjuder vi fantastiska möjligheter att förädla dina arkitekturfärdigheter, dela kunskap och utveckla dig tillsammans med skickliga kollegor i teamet. Du kan stationeras i Malmö eller Helsingborg efter vad du föredrar, båda kontoren centralt belägna med havsutsikt; över kajen i Malmö eller Öresund med blick mot Helsingör i Helsingborg.  

  

Vi har tre stora huvudområden för teamet:

* Integrationer med och utan moln (hybrid och multi-cloud)
* Enterprise arkitektur
* Composability

 **Din profil**

* Du är en person som redan har gedigen erfarenhet inom minst två av de huvudområden som nämns ovan
* Du har hands-on erfarenhet inom Azure, AWS eller GCP och kan bevisa det med motsvarande certifiering
* Du är tekniskt begåvad och har med största sannolikhet någon gång arbetat som utvecklare
* Du har god kommunikations- och presentationsförmåga i kombination med förmåga att leda och vilja att ta ansvar för kundleveranser
* Du ska trivas med tanken på att modernisera äldre lösningar som nått olika långt på olika plan och har massvis med konstiga integrationsplattformar och legacy-teknik, men även att bygga upp nya lösningar från scratch
* Du skriver och talar flytande svenska

 **… och erfarenhet eller intresse av:**  



* Erfarenhet av att skapa arkitektur för större lösningar med många inblandade produkter och multi-cloud
* Erfarenhet av att designa eventbaserade lösningar

 **Vad vi tror kommer att få dig att trivas**  

Vi erbjuder dig en dynamisk arbetsmiljö med andra digitala arkitekter inom Capgemini. Här får du möjligheten att arbeta i projekt med medelstora och stora internationella samt multinationella kunder. Du har friheten att utveckla dig själv med hjälp av Capgeminis egen utbildningsplattform som bl.a. ger dig tillgång till all molnrelaterad utbildning. Berätta om dina ambitioner och vi ser fram emot att hjälpa dig att nå dem: Get the future you want med oss på Capgemini!  

  

Förmåner:

* Föräldraförmån
* Flexibla arbetsförhållanden & Work-from-Home Policy
* Tech communities
* Mentorskapsprogram (som mentor eller mentee)
* Delaktighet i Capgeminis olika fokusområden; Diversity and Inclusion, Sustainability, Wellness club, Art club etc.
* Generöst friskvårdsbidrag & tjänstepension
* Bonusprogram
* Kompetensutveckling i form av utbildningar och certifieringar
* Roliga och inspirerande personalevent
* Företagshälsovård & sjukvårdsförsäkring
**Ansökan**

* *Vi arbetar med löpande urval så vänta inte - skicka in din ansökan redan idag. Vi ser framemot din ansökan och att du vill bli en del av vår fortsatta resa!*
* *Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess kommer identitetskontroll att genomföras genom granskning av ditt ID-kort, och bakgrundskontroller kan utföras vid behov.*

 **Om Capgemini**  

Capgemini är en global partner inom affärs- och tekniktransformation som hjälper organisationer att påskynda övergången till en digital och hållbar värld, och samtidigt gör skillnad för företag och samhälle. Det är en ansvarsfull och mångsidig organisation med 340 000 medarbetare i över 50 länder. Med ett starkt arv som sträcker sig över 55 år tillbaka har Capgemini sina kunders förtroende att hjälpa dem frigöra värdet av teknik för att tillgodose hela deras affärsbehov. Capgemini levererar helhetslösningar som utnyttjar styrkan från strategi och design till teknik. Allt drivet av en marknadsledande kapacitet inom AI, generativ AI, moln och data, kombinerat med en djup branschexpertis och ett ekosystem av partners. År 2024 rapporterade Capgemini Group globala intäkter på 22,1 miljarder euro.  

Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

title: CTO
description:
**Chief Technology Officer** 




**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden (MUST HAVE FULL RIGHT TO WORK AND PERMANENT RESIDENCY)
 



**Employment Type:** 
 Full-time
 



**Type:** 
 Hybrid
 



  





**Role Overview** 




 We are seeking an experienced and visionary CTO to lead the technology strategy and execution for our enterprise organization. The CTO will drive digital transformation, ensure a secure and scalable architecture, and maximize value from our Microsoft-centric technology stack, including Azure, .NET, Power Platform, and modern cloud solutions.
 



  





 The ideal candidate combines strong leadership, deep technical expertise across the Microsoft ecosystem, and a strategic mindset rooted in enterprise-level needs.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




**Technology Strategy & Leadership** 



* Define and execute the company’s technology vision aligned with business objectives.
* Lead cloud, architecture, data, and security strategy using Microsoft Azure and .NET technologies.
* Oversee technology governance, budgeting, and vendor management within the Microsoft partner ecosystem.



  





**Cloud & Infrastructure Management** 



* Drive cloud modernization using Azure IaaS, PaaS, serverless, and hybrid-cloud models.
* Ensure system scalability, resilience, and performance across the enterprise.



  





**Application & Platform Development** 



* Lead development of custom enterprise applications built with
 **Azure services, .NET,** 
 and DevOps.
* Promote engineering standards, automation, and integration across business systems.



  





**Compliance** 



* Ensuring platforms, cloud solutions, and architectures follow secure design principles
* Making sure engineering teams build secure products (DevSecOps)
* Integrating security into technology roadmaps
* Supporting Zero Trust, identity, and data protection strategies



  





**Data & AI** 



* Develop the company’s data and AI strategy
 
 using Azure Data Services, Fabric, and responsible AI practices.
* Enable data-driven decision-making and automation throughout the organization.



  





**Leadership & Collaboration** 



* Lead engineering, cybersecurity, architecture, and infrastructure teams.
* Collaborate with executive stakeholders to align technology capabilities with business strategy.
* Represent technology at the board and executive leadership level.



  





**Qualifications** 




**Experience** 



* 10+ years in senior technology leadership roles within enterprise environments.
* Proven experience in cloud transformation, modernization, or platform-driven initiatives.
* Strong background with the Microsoft ecosystem, including:
* Azure
* .NET
* Microsoft Security Suite



  





**Skills** 



* Strategic leadership with deep technical understanding.
* Expertise in cloud architecture, cybersecurity, data platforms, and enterprise integration.
* Strong communication and executive stakeholder management skills.
* Experience with budgeting, vendor management, and complex technology portfolios.



  





**What We Offer** 



* A key leadership role shaping the future of a modern, technology-driven enterprise.
* Competitive executive-level compensation and benefits.
* Opportunity to build and lead a world-class technology function in Stockholm.



  





 This is a brief description of the role, for the full information, simply apply to the role and I will call you to discuss.

 @\_TenthRevolution
 



**LinkedIn:** 
 https://www.linkedin.com/in/sarah-king-624956160/
 



**Email:** 
 s.king@tenthrevolution.com
 



**Phone:** 
 +46 8 502 425 40

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description:
**Be a part of the next big thing**
 Do you thrive on tackling complex challenges? Are you passionate about creating impactful solutions that drive commerce forward? Do you believe in encouraging and elevating those around you?
   

  

**About Us**
 Kustom, formerly known as Klarna Checkout (KCO), is the Nordic market leader in digital checkout solutions. Today, we support over 24,000 merchants across more than 170 countries, providing a streamlined checkout experience. We offer localized solutions in 18 markets, tailored to specific languages, currencies, and payment methods. No matter where businesses operate, we deliver a checkout experience that meets the needs of both merchants and shoppers—driving growth globally. 🌍
   

  

**The role**
 As an Infrastructure Engineer at Kustom, you’ll play a key role in building and evolving the platform that powers one of the most trusted checkout solutions in the Nordics. You’ll work across cloud infrastructure, data, networking and observability to ensure our systems remain secure, scalable and resilient as we continue to grow.
   

  

 You’ll collaborate closely with engineers across product, backend and data to design solutions that support high availability and low latency. This role is perfect for someone who enjoys solving hard technical problems, driving automation and enabling teams to ship with confidence.
   

  

**Things you'll be doing**
* Designing, building and maintaining scalable cloud infrastructure on AWS to support high-traffic, mission-critical systems
* Managing and improving our Kubernetes environments, ensuring smooth deployments, strong security and reliable performance
* Implementing Infrastructure as Code using Terraform to automate provisioning, configuration and change management
* Enhancing observability across services using Datadog (metrics, tracing, alerting) to ensure fast issue detection and resolution
* Optimizing PostgreSQL databases, including schema design, indexing and performance tuning
* Working with event-driven systems and streaming platforms like Kafka to support real-time data flows
* Collaborating with backend teams to design and deliver resilient architectures and efficient deployment pipelines
* Driving continuous improvements in automation, tooling and reliability across our infrastructure
* Troubleshooting complex production issues related to performance, scaling, networking or distributed systems
* Contributing to documentation, best practices and cross-team knowledge sharing


**Skills And Experience You'll Need**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field
* Extensive hands-on experience with Amazon Web Services core services (EC2, CloudFront, RDS, S3, etc.)
* Strong expertise in Kubernetes and container orchestration best practices
* Proficiency with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform or similar tools)
* Solid understanding of networking fundamentals (VPC, routing, load balancing, DNS)
* Experience with observability platforms like Datadog for metrics, tracing and alerting
* Solid understanding of PostgreSQL, including schema design, indexing and query optimization
* Familiarity with event-driven architectures and data technologies such as Kafka
* Strong programming skills in Java (Spring Boot)
* Proficient in Git for version control and collaboration


**We believe you'll thrive in this role if you have**
* Passion for building reliable, automated and secure infrastructure at scale
* Experience managing high-availability, mission critical systems in production
* Ability to diagnose and solve complex performance, networking and scaling challenges
* A track record of driving automation, reducing toil and improving operational efficiency
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate across teams and explain complex systems clearly
* Strong commitment to infrastructure-as-code, testing and high-quality documentation


**Benefits**
* Robust pension plan with national and occupational components
* Excellent health insurance coverage, including long-term illness protection and salary exchange options
* Annual wellness allowance of 3,000 SEK to invest in your health and fitness
* Extra day off when major holidays (e.g., Christmas Eve, New Year's Eve) fall on weekends
* Continuous learning opportunities and professional development support


**A place to grow**
 At Kustom, you won’t just be another face in the crowd. This is a place where we elevate each other and celebrate success as a team. We believe in our ability to create excellence - and have fun doing it!
   

  

 We know we set high expectations, but we also know that the road to success isn’t a straight line. We support and encourage each other to try, to fail, to try again. Because that’s how we grow, individually and together.
   

  

 Does this sound like the place for you?
   

  

**About Your Application**
* Please apply in English. At Kustom, we welcome everyone! We don’t care where you’re from, whom you love, or what kind of food is your favorite. We believe in inclusivity for all.
* Given the above, we treat all candidates the same! That’s why we have this awesome recruitment tool to keep track of all the amazing talents that apply - so please; apply through the system and we’ll make sure to keep you updated along the recruitment process. Please note that we can’t keep track of CVs or similar documents sent via email.
* We value your privacy! When you apply, we'll handle your data with care. Want to know more about how we use your information? Check out our FAQs at the bottom of the jobs page - we've got all the details there for you!

title: Solutions Architect
description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging status quo in the property management industry. We are committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our rapidly growing product and engineering organization now includes around 200 highly skilled professionals.
 



 Our cloud-based platform is unique, and in a brief time, we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player on the market. Our product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?
   





 We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Solutions Architect to join our dynamic UK team. This role is pivotal in providing both solution and enterprise-level architecture expertise, ensuring the successful integration and development of our software systems. As a Senior Solution Architect, you will play a crucial role in setting strategy and roadmaps for our in-house applications, particularly in an environment experiencing significant M&A growth.
 



 You will collaborate with colleagues in the UK Product & Engineering teams as well as with those working in other markets to identify potential cross-market synergies and opportunities.
 



 You will support the architecture vision, and the enabling capabilities required to meet them. You will report to our Lead Architect and work in close collaboration with our UK product engineering teams and other architects.
 



 You can be based in either the Stockholm area or the London area for this role.
 



**Who You Are:** 
  

 You are a strategic thinker with a robust technical background, who thrives in dynamic environments and is adept at navigating the complexities of mergers and acquisitions. You are a proactive problem-solver with excellent communication skills, capable of leading and inspiring teams to achieve innovative architectural solutions.
 



 You work well with others and know how to convey complex concepts to a wide range of stakeholders. Your communication style is clear and inclusive. The ability to deal with complexity and heterogeneous environments, including both legacy and modern technologies, is key.
 



**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Support the development of the technical strategy for the UK region, ensuring alignment with the company's overall vision and goals.
* Serve as the technical leader and mentor for development teams, fostering a culture of collaboration and excellence.
* Oversee the architecture design and development of complex web-based systems and applications.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration and delivery of solutions.
* Conduct regular reviews and assessments of technical processes and systems to identify areas for improvement.
* Stay abreast of industry trends and emerging technologies to drive continuous innovation.
* Provide technical guidance and support during project planning, execution, and delivery phases.
* Ensure adherence to best practices in software development, architecture, and agile methodologies.



**Qualifications:** 



* Proven experience as a Solutions Architect or similar role, with a strong background in both solution and enterprise architecture.
* Excellent leadership and mentoring skills, with the ability to inspire and guide development teams.
* Proficiency in relevant technologies and tools, such as Azure DevOps, C#, .NET Core, MS Dynamics, AWS Services, and microservices architecture.
* Exceptional problem-solving skills and the ability to think strategically.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across teams and regions.
* Experience in environments undergoing significant M&A growth is highly desirable.



**What we offer** 



* Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
* Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools and encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work.
* Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
* Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.



**Excited?** 
  

 If you are excited about being part of a successful team, apply for this position!
 



 👉🏽 Why we formed Odevo
   

 🔍 About Odevo
   

 🌐 Our Software
   

 #msl

title: Konsultchef – ALTEN Stockholm
description:
**Vill du kombinera försäljning, kundansvar och ledarskap i en roll med stor påverkan? Har du ett intresse för teknik eller IT och vill bygga ett eget konsultteam? Då kan du vara rätt person för ALTEN i Stockholm.** 




  





 Vi söker en konsultchef som vill utveckla affärer och relationer med kunder inom digitalisering, teknik och IT – samtidigt som du leder och coachar konsulter i deras uppdrag.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som konsultchef arbetar du i gränslandet mellan affärer, människor och teknik. Du driver försäljningsprocesser tillsammans med våra kunder, rekryterar kompetens och ansvarar för rådgivande ledarskap för ditt team.
 



  





 Du får stöd från våra interna funktioner inom Talent Acquisition, HR, juridik och leverans – men rollen kräver eget driv och en vilja att bygga långsiktiga kundrelationer.
 



  





**Dina ansvar** 



* Utveckla och skapa affärer inom teknik- och IT-tjänster
* Driva säljprocessen: prospektering, behovsanalys, offerter och avtal
* Rekrytera konsulter tillsammans med Talent Acquisition
* Leda, coacha och utveckla dina konsulter i deras uppdrag
* Ansvara för planering, budget och lönsamhet inom ditt område
* Samverka med andra affärsområden och bidra till ALTENs tillväxt i Stockholm



  





**Vem vi söker** 




 Du har erfarenhet från kundnära arbete och gillar att skapa relationer, driva affärer och hjälpa både kunder och konsulter att lyckas. Du behöver inte vara senior, men du ska ha ambitionen att utvecklas i rollen.
 



  





**Vi tror att du har:** 



* Erfarenhet av B2B-sälj eller kundansvar (gärna inom tjänster eller teknik)
* Intresse för teknik, IT eller digitalisering
* God kommunikativ förmåga och trygghet i att bygga relationer
* Relevant eftergymnasial utbildning (t.ex. ekonomi, teknik, management, IT, business)
* Flytande svenska och engelska
* B-körkort



  





**Meriterande** 
 men inte krav: erfarenhet av rekrytering, projektledning eller personalansvar.
 



  





**Om ALTEN** 




 ALTEN är en av Europas ledande aktörer inom teknik- och IT-konsulting. I Stockholm arbetar vi med både globala industriföretag och snabbväxande teknikbolag. Här får du arbeta i en miljö som kombinerar entreprenörskap, affärsdriven kultur och internationell styrka.
 



  





**Vi erbjuder** 



* Stort mandat att påverka din egen affär och bygga ditt team
* Tydligt bonussystem kopplat till resultat
* Utbildning inom försäljning, ledarskap och verksamhetsutveckling
* Möjlighet att utvecklas till senior konsultchef eller affärsområdesansvarig
* En kultur som präglas av samarbete, ansvar och entreprenörskap



  





**Vill du utvecklas inom försäljning och ledarskap i en teknikdriven miljö? Ansök idag – vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!**

title: Cyber Security Solution Engineer
description:
* Applications are considered on a rolling basis


**Job Description**
**What you will do**
 As a Solution Engineer, you'll be the technical expertise of our sales team which means you will translate complex security solutions into clear, actionable insights for potential and existing clients. In this role you will be working with both pre-sale and post-sale.
   

  

 You'll design and build comprehensive Demos and POCs, showcasing the value of our solutions and their fit for the prospect's specific technical needs. You'll also be the point person for all technical questions, providing answers or seamlessly connecting prospects with the right team member. Working alongside sales representatives and account executives in your team, you'll be analyzing customer needs and usage to propose effective solutions enabling them to stay secure.
   

  

 You'll ensure successful customer onboarding and product adoption, becoming a trusted advisor for our enterprise customers. Leveraging your technical knowledge, you'll proactively solve complex problems and identify areas for optimization. As a champion for best practices, you'll advocate for effective processes within the sales organization. And as a champion for our customers' needs you’ll collaborate tightly with our product teams to help us build products that our customers love. You'll also provide guidance and mentorship to junior colleagues, fostering a collaborative and supportive environment.
   

  

**Skills & Requirements**
**Skills & Requirements**
**Who You Are**
* You have previous experience of sales in the software industry, both pre-sales and post-sales, and an understanding of technical frameworks .
* You have experience in cloud app architecture and web app development, including experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud), web frameworks (React, Angular, Node.js), APIs, and python scripting.
* You can explain technical concepts with ease through presentations, demos, and whiteboard sessions and have the ability to run a full POC and troubleshoot technical challenges.
* You can analyze client needs and craft solutions that seamlessly integrate Detectify into their security posture.
* You thrive on tackling complex challenges, finding creative solutions that empower businesses.
* Experience from the cybersecurity industry is immensely valued but not necessary provided you have sufficient technical expertise and proven high ability to learn on the job


**So, what do you think?**
 We are proud to foster an inclusive workplace free from discrimination. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to be a part of changing the way the world thinks about security! Go hack yourself!
   

  

**Hybrid work**
 This position is for the Stockholm office. We offer hybrid working and would like to see you working from our office in central Stockholm several days per week. We currently do not offer relocation for this position.

title: Staff Platform Engineer, EU
description:
We’re looking for a curious, rigorous, problem-hungry platform engineer (who codes!) to carry the ball as we bring Ashby to the big leagues. Ashby builds software that lets talent teams build an efficient, delightful, respectful hiring process. Similarly, you’re an engineer who wants to build a “paved road” that excellent engineering teams can safely take to the moon and back.
   

  

 We have notable customers like Notion, Linear, Shopify, and Snowflake. Our growth and retention metrics are best-in-class among our peers: we have tens of millions in ARR, growing >100% year over year, over 2500 customers, very low churn, and many years of runway. We’ll share more details once we meet, but you now probably have a good idea as to why we're hiring for this role 😅.
   

  

 We’ve listed this role twice: as a Platform Engineer and Site Reliability Engineer – our team does both, and we are open to candidates who lean towards one or the other.
   

  

**About The Role And How We Work**
 Hi 👋 I’m Colin, Head of EMEA Engineering. I’ve spent a number of years leading engineering teams in startups, and that has always included being close to infrastructure teams - no matter what name they’ve worn (SRE, infrastructure, platform, etc). I’ve got my hands dirty building the initial infrastructure for startups and know the value a talented infrastructure engineer brings. The rigour, the discipline, the peace and quiet when everything just
 *hums along* 
 .
   

  

 Our infrastructure is in a good place
 *for now* 
 . Nothing is static. Ashby continues to grow rapidly, putting strain on our existing infrastructure. We’re always looking to give our customers more powerful hiring software, and building new product features often requires new pieces of infrastructure.
   

  

 Having herded plenty of
 *snowflakeservers* 
 in the past, I’ve learned there’s a better way. I (and Ashby) place a lot of value on infrastructure-as-code. As a Platform Engineer at Ashby, you’ll get to dive into scaling problems, add new capabilities to our platform, and think about how our entire team interacts with infrastructure. All our own engineers own their projects end-to-end and ship with minimal oversight. We don’t put roadblocks to ensure security when common sense will do and we don’t build processes like change management boards around the lowest common denominator. But with great power comes great responsibility: we handle personal and confidential data about some of the biggest decisions we ever make at work. As we grow, more and bigger customers rely on us to be reliable and secure and how we operate internally will need to evolve.
   

  

 We’re at an inflection point where our ability to scale and deliver a seamless experience has a make-or-break impact – we have some of the fastest growing companies using our platform every day to hire hundreds of people per month. We need someone like you to make good decisions, debug thorny issues, and build us a future-proof platform that can withstand this scale. Our small but mighty infrastructure team has set up a secure and simple environment (we don’t believe in spinning up a new service unless necessary!) for our growing product team to build in. That’s where you come in: you, too, will own projects end-to-end and have an impact on core parts of the Ashby developer and user experience. For instance, you could work on:
   

  

* Optimize our homegrown ultra-dynamic recruiting DSL-to-SQL compiler, and create tools to help developers do so
* Create automated guardrails for the security and privacy of our customer data
* Help our developers ship features fast through canary deploys, gradual rollouts and feature flags, while keeping complexity manageable and reducing downtime
* Work with the business and the engineering team to define SLOs and implement the corresponding SLIs.
* Ensure all communication with external services supports retries and circuit-breakers.
* Implement the infrastructure to support an event-driven architecture and data warehouse.


 We’re looking for someone who can build systems that an engineer would like to work with: mature and boring but open-minded and approachable. We have to balance reliability with flexibility. Software and its availability are now mission critical to almost every working professional. To be in an SRE in today’s world, you have to be extremely comfortable evaluating risk, those you take and those others take.
   

  

 Why you should or shouldn’t apply
   

  

**You Should Apply If**
* You never stop. You get weirdly obsessed about a problem that doesn’t yet make sense, turn it every which way in your head until the explanation dawns. You’ll search every rock, inventory every clue, hunt every mismatch. We do that, too - together we’ll be armed with state-of-the-art monitoring tools and an impressive amount of data, and join you in the adventure.
* You don’t take shortcuts. You’re speaking up for the future user, the edge case, the doomsday design. You know product engineers want to build it with you, and see them as allies, where you give them the power and knowledge to access greater things.
* You’re someone who cares about what you do and the team you do it with, and want to work with others who do as well. You’ll be on interview panels choosing your next colleagues, and you’ll take that seriously. You only want to work with people who make you better, and want to make you better.
* You’ve built infrastructure at a slightly later stage than Ashby is at - you know how to deal with millions of data points, have seen great (or not great) infrastructure make or break customer experience, and have automated everything from provisioning to monitoring and release process.
* You’re a Swiss army knife (all nationalities welcome ;) ). You’ll get every hard problem the company faces. You’ll get to do infrastructure updates, security enforcements, database optimization, Kubernetes debugging, and digging through Typescript traces figuring out what doesn’t work. You probably don’t feel like an expert at at least some of that... and that appeals to you.


**Role**
 All that makes for a pretty specific kind of role, and the job isn’t to everyone’s tastes! You should not apply if:
   

  

* You don’t want to make your own decisions on what is the best paved road to build for Ashby, and expect a lead or manager to make the final call on what that is. Our leads (and managers) give ample commentary and feedback on technical decisions and how they’re made, but you ship what you want to build and are accountable for it.
* You hate SQL. We have a lot of features built around making the best out of data, and our platform engineers also sometimes dive into a gnarly report or advise engineers on a more performant data model to use.
* You don’t want to code. Our SREs are some of our best software engineers and they are just as responsible for the application as the other engineering teams - albeit at a platform level. Reviewing code and submitting code changes will be part of your day to day.
* Your primary mode of communicating best practices to engineers is live meetings. We’re a very async culture and written communication (and code) is how changes get made. As an Ashby SRE, you will need to share new tooling and best practices with engineers faster than your next meeting opportunity will take you.
* You’ve never delivered a project, on your own, without someone prodding you for updates. We have no project or delivery managers to fill your calendar with busy work, but the flip side is you have to do your project management, seek the help you need to get unstuck and cut scope when it’s worthwhile.


 Technology Stack
   

  

 I’m sharing our tech stack with the caveat that we don’t require previous experience in it: TypeScript (frontend & backend), Node.js, React, Apollo GraphQL, Postgres, Redis.
   

  

 We use Datadog and Sentry on 100% cloud-based (AWS) infra. We take developer experience and reliability seriously: all engineers are on call in a follow-the-sun model, and everyone contributes to developer tooling.
   

  

 What We’re Building
   

  

 As engineers, we are used to tooling that makes us
 **better**
